2. **Familiarize yourself with popular Generative AI libraries and frameworks**: TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras are popular choices for building generative models. Experimenting with these libraries will help you develop practical skills.
3. **Build a portfolio of projects showcasing your skills**: Share your work on platforms like GitHub or Kaggle to demonstrate your expertise. This will also help you build connections in the Generative AI community.
4. **Stay up-to-date with industry trends and research**: Follow prominent researchers, attend webinars, and read papers related to Generative AI. This will keep you informed about breakthroughs and new applications.
